alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 24 at 5:39AM EST until December 24 at 5:48PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Hampshire and Maine... Saco River At Conway affecting Carroll, Oxford, and Cumberland Counties. For the Saco River...including Conway, West Buxton...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Saco River at Conway. * WHEN...Until late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Faster flows along the river are expected but no flooding occurs. Interests near the river should continue to monitor later forecasts. High risks for recreational paddlers. At 7.0 feet, Minor flooding as Moat Brook backs up and floods Transvale Road, cutting off access to a dozen homes and camps. Beaches at area camps flooded. At 8.0 feet, Flooding begins along the east bank campgrounds in Conway and North Conway. Campers along the river should move to higher ground. At 9.0 feet, Expect flooding of low-bottom fields and private roads in Conway and North Conway. Minor flooding in Transvale Acres, Moat Brook Bridge, and the lower part of E. Road flood. At 10.0 feet, Minor flooding occurs as floodwaters surround properties across Transvale Acres. Flood waters 1 to 2 feet deep in sections of east bank camping areas. I * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 AM EST Saturday the stage was 9.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage around midday. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
